sentences: Alfred Heinrich Ehrlich (5 October 1822, in Vienna – 30 December 1899, in Berlin) was a pianist, composer and writer on music.
From 1840 to 1844 he performed in Hungary, Romania and Vienna.
In 1848, he became correspondent for the Augsburger Allgemeine Zeitung, pianist of King George V of Hanover in 1852, moving to Wiesbaden in 1855.
Two years later he went to England and finally settled in Berlin in 1862.
From 1864 to 1872 he was a piano teacher at the Stern Conservatory.

In addition to his journalistic work, Ehrlich became a writer and published novels and musical studies, which were very popular in his day, among which are Schlaglichter und Schlagschatten aus der Music Welt (1872),  Wie übt man Klavier?
